dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, great news everyone, the National Security Committee just announced that, like, all the illegal weapons in the country have been seized! Problem solved!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, great news everyone, the National Security Committee just announced that, like, all the illegal weapons in the country have been seized! Problem solved!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Security Committee (NSC) has released an update on efforts to seize illegal weapons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, no, that’s actually not what they said at all. They, um, released an update on efforts to seize illegal weapons.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, no, that's actually not what they said at all. They, um, released an update on efforts to seize illegal weapons.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Security Committee (NSC) has released an update on efforts to seize illegal weapons.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, efforts. Right. So, what, exactly, have these "efforts" amounted to? Like, a water pistol?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, efforts. Right. So, what, exactly, have these efforts amounted to? Like, a water pistol?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, since the beginning of 2025, in cooperation with police, they’ve confiscated 12 automatic rifles and 41 pistols.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, since the beginning of twenty twenty five, in cooperation with police, they've confiscated twelve automatic rifles and forty one pistols.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of 2025, the NSC, in cooperation with the police and the prosecutor's office, has confiscated the following illegal weapons: 12 automatic rifles, 41 pistols...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Twelve rifles? Forty-one pistols? Is that, like, supposed to be impressive for an entire country? That sounds like a Tuesday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twelve rifles? Forty-one pistols? Is that, like, supposed to be impressive for an entire country? That sounds like a Tuesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, wait, there's more. They also got 75 shotguns, 36 grenades, and, uh, 1,603 rounds of various calibers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, wait, there's more. They also got seventy five shotguns, thirty six grenades, and, uh, sixteen oh three rounds of various calibers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...75 shotguns, 36 grenades, and 1,603 rounds of various calibers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Grenades? Okay, that’s, uh, a bit more serious. But where are all these just coming from, though? Like, just lying around?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Grenades? Okay, that's, uh, a bit more serious. But where are all these just coming from, though? Like, just lying around?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A significant portion, they say, was stolen during the January events. They've seized 608 firearms from that crisis period since 2022.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A significant portion, they say, was stolen during the January events. They've seized six hundred eight firearms from that crisis period since twenty twenty two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A significant portion of these weapons was stolen during the January events (since 2022, the NSC has seized a total of 608 firearms lost during the crisis period).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The "January events." How convenient. So, any weapon they find now is just, what, automatically linked back to that? No new sources?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The January events. How convenient. So, any weapon they find now is just, what, automatically linked back to that? No new sources?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They say it "mitigated the risk" of these weapons falling into "destructive environments" and being used against, you know, society and the state.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They say it mitigated the risk of these weapons falling into destructive environments and being used against, you know, society and the state.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This has mitigated the risk of these weapons falling into destructive environments and being used against the interests of society and the state," the NSC press service stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Destructive environments." Who are they even talking about with that vague, uh, language? Sounds like an excuse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Destructive environments. Who are they even talking about with that vague, uh, language? Sounds like an excuse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they also reported cases of illegal arms smuggling into Kazakhstan! They, um, intercepted a channel from a neighboring country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they also reported cases of illegal arms smuggling into Kazakhstan! They, um, intercepted a channel from a neighboring country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The NSC also reported cases of illegal arms smuggling into Kazakhstan. ... The NSC has intercepted a weapons smuggling channel from a neighboring country...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A "neighboring country." Naturally. And who was doing the smuggling? A shadowy international villain, I assume?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A neighboring country. Naturally. And who was doing the smuggling? A shadowy international villain, I assume?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A foreign national was detained, intending to sell "dozens of firearms" within Kazakhstan. They were concealed in a car’s interior lining.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A foreign national was detained, intending to sell dozens of firearms within Kazakhstan. They were concealed in a car's interior lining.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...detaining a foreign national who intended to sell dozens of firearms within Kazakhstan. The weapons were concealed in the car™s interior lining...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Dozens." Again, with the vague numbers. Were these all just from one guy in a car? Sounds like, uh, a bit of a convenient narrative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dozens. Again, with the vague numbers. Were these all just from one guy in a car? Sounds like, uh, a bit of a convenient narrative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He had accomplices among Kazakhstani citizens, though. So, it wasn't just him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He had accomplices among Kazakhstani citizens, though. So, it wasn't just him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and smuggled with the assistance of accomplices among Kazakhstani citizens," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it is an internal issue then, not just some random "foreign national" dropping off weapons? Interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it is an internal issue then, not just some random foreign national dropping off weapons? Interesting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The Border Service of the NSC also held, like, 3,216 violators of Kazakhstani law accountable in the border area earlier.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Border Service of the N S C also held, like, three thousand, two hundred sixteen violators of Kazakhstani law accountable in the border area earlier.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, the Border Service of the NSC held 3,216 violators of Kazakhstani law accountable in the border area, in cooperation with other competent authorities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And are those, um, all weapons violations? Or just, like, people who forgot their passports? They just lump it all together, don't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And are those, um, all weapons violations? Or just, like, people who forgot their passports? They just lump it all together, don't they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, the Border Service of the NSC held 3,216 violators of Kazakhstani law accountable in the border area, in cooperation with other competent authorities.
